cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 535 mi SSE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest to north-northwest and forecast to approach the middle Texas coast, then meander inland toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Port O'Connor–Matagorda Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Mansfield and from north of San Luis Pass to High Island, including Port Arthur vicinity
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield to High Island and portions of southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: 30% chance of tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) and up to 6% chance of ≥50 kt; sustained winds at the port could reach 35–45 mph with higher gusts late Friday into the weekend.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm Surge Watch in effect; 4–6 ft inundation possible near Sabine Pass and coastal areas adjacent to Port Arthur if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals near 20 inches possible Friday through Monday, producing life-threatening flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged flooding from slow storm motion, possible river and bayou rises affecting terminal access roads and rail lines.
